Posts.Content: Godblessedeveryone wrote: Can anyone tell me what's my next step? I'm going to consult the oncologist this coming Thursday with my mom, my mom doesn't really wants to have chemotherapy done. What are your suggestions ladies? Is this report consider as a good one? What else do I have to take note in order to take care of my mom? Kindly guide me and give me some good suggestions and share me with your experiences, perhaps? Thanks in advanced. *hugs* P/S : I feel so thankful that my mom's lymph nodes and margins are all clear, and the report turn out to be a better one compare to others... God bless everyone! Dx 3/2016, IDC, Left, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just got the histopathology report Godblessedeveryone NancyHB

Posts.Content: Godblessedeveryone wrote: Hi everyone, can anyone please explain to me what kind of report are consider as "good" news to us? Regarding to the tumor results from panthalogy. What is it HER2 and nodes positive/negative? What's the possibility of outcomes usually people get after surgery? I sincerely hope that my mom's report shows that chemotherapy/radiotherapy are not needed for her treatment. My mom keep telling me that she's afraid that she might need to go through all these... I felt so helpless. All I can do is to do research for her, looking for alternatives way in curing cancer. Dx 3/2016, IDC, Left, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feeling anxious on the report of my mom's after her lumpectomy. Godblessedeveryone BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Godblessedeveryone wrote: Hi, I would like to know what kind of "important" questions I should ask the oncologist when we are having an appointment with him? Should I ask him question like why my mom have to do chemotherapy? Is it necessary to do it? (if he do ask my mom to do it) Dx 3/2016, IDC, Left, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
